intro: Trichomanes brooksii, commonly known as the Brooks' maidenhair fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that resemble those of other maidenhair ferns. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rock crevices or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are located on the underside of the fronds and produce spores for propagation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for ecosystem health.
